intro: Torularia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted torularia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or pale yellow. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters. Torularia bracteata is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
